oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of veteran Pvt. Simon Peter Driver, Co. B, 7th Tenn. Cav., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Driver served initially in Co. G, 51st Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He escaped Fort Donelson and was discharged in 1863. He later joined Co. B, 7th Tenn. Cav., CSA. The image shows him wearing a reunion era uniform and cap. Although he served as a private during the war, his coat has colonel insignia reflecting his rank in the United Confederate Veterans. He also wears his Forrest's Men Association badge. He was buried in Covington, Tennessee upon his death in 1930.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Driver, Simon Peter
